page.title: 12The new railway in Trimley
page.content: Felixstowe Docks have two Freightliner Terminals,where containers are loaded on to railway wagons. One is in our block. The trains have to travel right through the docks to join the line which passes through Trimley, causing long traffic delays. To avoid these delays,the Dock Company planned a new railway from the Walton Freightliner Terminal to the Ipswich line near Trimley Station, following roughly along Byle Fleet. People living near the route objected and the Trimley Preservation Society was formed to oppose the private bill in Parliament,but it was still passed. The line has been marked out and no crops have been grown on the route this year,but no work has begun yet. Some people think that the line will be noisy and that dock buildings will come closer to the village.
